message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.MA 

This paper discusses the training of game playing agents using reinforcement learning algorithms in a social context, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of tournaments for training, which is related to game theory (cs.GT) and multi-agent systems (cs.MA). The comparison of agents trained in social settings to those trained in self-play environments involves the evaluation of learning algorithms, which is related to machine learning (cs.LG) and social influence (cs.SI).
